result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas B. Baker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Douglas B. Baker in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Defendant Douglas B. Baker in custody.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court sentences DEF to 90 days county jail with huber  credit for 75 days (time served) costs $268.00 apply bond balance of bond to probation.

copies routed

Defendant Douglas B. Baker in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Defendant Douglas B. Baker in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts, def pleads NC  found guilty,  DA recites agreement  DEF to 90 days county jail with huber consecutive to 13CF200 costs $268.00,  Court orders PSI long form reset for Sentencing to 3-17-15 3:30 pm

Defendant Douglas B. Baker in court, in custody, with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail continues.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
DEF appears late with atty Schlough, cancel warrant, ADA John Yackel appears for the state, DEF has not been reported to STOP, Preliminary hearing is waived on this case,
Attorney Scott S. Schlough in court.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Start Forfeiture Proceedings  Bail/Bond Review scheduled for November 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Douglas B. Baker in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 10:00 am.

SPECIAL BOND Conditions with Random Testing
1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
EXCEPT that defendant may be on the premises of: 
for the purpose of employment, but only for the purpose of employment and only during his/her hours of employment.
3. Defendant shall be subject to RANDOM TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.

Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons.
Defendant shall not consume alcoholic beverages or illegal drugs.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid drivers license.
Defendant is ordered to report to Health and Human Services at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI within 48 hours (excluding weekends and holidays) upon release from custody to schedule an intake with a stop case manager (715-638-3317) for the purpose of setting up a procedure to monitor compliance with the bond provisions.  Failure to appear may result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, a bond modification hearing, possible bail jumping charges and / or forfeiture of any bond deposit.
